enable.description: Enables (or disables) the entire JSON for the ProcessDataCommand's InputJson property.

description.description: An optional description for the entire JSON data structure for ProcessDataCommand's InputJson property.

operation_list.description: An ordered list of operations to be processed by ProcessDataCommand.

operation.description: Presented here is a oneOf clause that permits only one operation per operation object. Each is defined else where for clarity here.

db_table.description: db_table sub op defines a database table as the source or destination for an operation.

description.description: An author provided description for the use of the db_table sub op.

drop_table_if_exists.description: True if the table is to be dropped and recreated if it already exists.

db_name.description: An optional database moniker, generally SUMMARY is the default if this is not provided.

table_name.description: The name of the database table that will be used in the db_table sub op (either read from or written to).

verdict.description: Not fully defined at this time...

command_pass_fail_state.description: This sub op will set the ProcessDataCommand's pass-fail state so that the ProcessDataCommand can be used as an expression in an IF or WHILE sequencer command.

description.description: An author provided description for the use of the command_pass_fail_state sub op.

status_value_on_fail.description: Author provided text that is placed into the ProcessDataCommand's Status property if the ProcessDataCommand's pass-fail state is set to Fail.

description.description: An author-defined description of this source or destination type.

object_handle.description: Object handle of a BLL object.

tag_name_list.description: A list of tag names that tag BLL objects of interest.  When omitted, all objects in the system will be examined.

enable_recursive_search.description: Flag indicating recursive search should be done.  When enabled, all object of given type will be returned starting with the tagged objects.  When disabled, only the tagged objects will be compared against the given type.

class_name.description: Class name of the BLL objects of interest.  When omitted, all properties are considered.

property_name_list.description: List of property names of the BLL object with given class name.

json_key.description: A JSON key providing a path into a JSON object stored (as a string) in a BLL property.  When specified, the property_name_list must contain a single property (that is of JSON string format).

relation_list.description: List of Relations to traverse. Append -sources to name to traverse in the reverse direction.  Note that if this property is empty, will only use the default list, which traverses ParentChild and AffiliationPort-sources. All traversed relations must be included explicitly in this list.

ignore_failures.description: Flag to ignore failures when getting or setting BLL objects and properties.

enable_explicit_order.description: Flag to search the objects based on the order of relation defined in the relation_list.

bll_object_property.description: Source or destination BLL object(s) property.

description.description: An author-defined description of this source or destination type.

object_handle.description: Object handle of a BLL object.

tag_name_list.description: A list of tag names that tag BLL objects of interest.  When omitted, all objects in the system will be examined.

enable_recursive_search.description: Flag indicating recursive search should be done.  When enabled, all object of given type will be returned starting with the tagged objects.  When disabled, only the tagged objects will be compared against the given type.

class_name.description: Class name of the BLL objects of interest.  When omitted, all properties are considered.

property_name.description: Property name of the BLL object with given class name.

json_key.description: A JSON key providing a path into a JSON object stored (as a string) in a BLL property.  When specified, the property_name_list must contain a single property (that is of JSON string format).

relation_list.description: List of Relations to traverse. Append -sources to name to traverse in the reverse direction.  Note that if this property is empty, will only use the default list, which traverses ParentChild and AffiliationPort-sources. All traversed relations must be included explicitly in this list.

ignore_failures.description: Flag to ignore failures when getting or setting BLL objects and properties.

enable_explicit_order.description: Flag to search the objects based on the order of relation defined in the relation_list.

description.description: An author-defined description of this source or destination type.

tag_name_list.description: A list of tag names that tag iterator command objects of interest.

log_output.description: Log the incoming data from a source to the TestCenter logs. Author use only to debug and view source output. Destination only.

description.description: An author-defined description of this destination type.

log_level.description: Specify the log level. Optional property and default is Info.

influx_db_query_ref.description: Defines an influx DB connection for queries.

description.description: An author provided description for the influx DB query.

host.description: Influx DB host (localhost or an IP address where the influx DB can be reached)

query.description: Influx DB query.  Uses sql_statement syntax.

epoch.description: Format of the timestamps in returned data.  Use rfc3339 for a human-readable timestamp (ie for charting).

enable_merge_tables.description: Enable the merging of multiple series (tables) in the case when an Influx DB query returns multiple series (ie when using GROUP BY on a tag).

ignore_influx_connection_errors.description: Set this flag to True to ignore errors when while connecting to InfluxDB. If False (default) and no valid connection exists, the operation shall fail and return an error.

influx_db_add_ref.description: Defines an influx DB connection for addition.

description.description: An author provided description for the influx DB query.

host.description: Influx DB host (localhost or an IP address where the influx DB can be reached)

include_session_token.description: Including the session token as a tag

measurement.description: Specifies the target measurement (table name) for an InfluxDB

tag_field_list.description: Specify which fields are to be added as tags in InfluxDB

static_tags.description: A dictionary containing key-value pairs corresponding to string tag names and values, all points processed will receive the same values

timestamp_field.description: Specify which field is used as a timetsamp

timestamp_value.description: Specify a timestamp value (ns from epoch RFC 3338)

description.description: An author provided description for the use of the sql sub op.

db_name.description: An optional database moniker, generally SUMMARY is the default if this is not provided.

max_attempts_if_locked.description: Optional: The maximum number of attempts to perform the SQL statement that will be made before failure due to a locked database.

sql_statement.description: This property defines the SQL query statement.

oneOf.description: This is a single string of the SQL query statement embedded variable to be substituted.

items.description: This property defines a portion of the SQL query statement.

enable.description: Enables this portion of the SQL statement.

static.description: This is a static portion of the SQL query statement.

enable.description: Enables this portion of the SQL statement.

variable.description: This is a variable portion of the SQL query statement, the value is the name of the variable. Scalar is the only variable type supported.

enable.description: Enables this portion of the SQL statement.

variable.description: Defines a variable src or dst.

description.description: An author provided description for the use of this variable.

static_value.description: Defines a static_value src. Identical to the common_data_format.

transfer_data.description: Generic operation to transfer/move/copy data from any source to any destination.

enable.description: This operation is processed if true, ignored otherwise.

description.description: An author provided description for the use of the transfer_data operation.

run_sql.description: This operation will execute an SQL query against a database.

enable.description: This source is processed if true, ignored otherwise.

description.description: An author provided description for the use of the run_sql op.
An author provided description for the use of the run_sql op.

dst.description: Optional list of destination sub ops (none are required if SQL query produces no data).

items.description: One of the following object types are valid for the run_sql operation; and only one per dst object.

description.description: An author provided description for the use of the db_table sub op.

transform_list.description: Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to sending to the db_table sub op.

transform_list.description: Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to sending to the sub op.

get_bll_object_data.description: A sub operation that gets data from bll objects and stores it in a destination.

transform_list.description: Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to setting bll_object_property.

set_bll_object_data.description: A sub operation that sets data to bll objects.

transform_list.description: Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to setting bll_object_property.
Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to setting bll_object.

create_report_table.description: This operation will generate a table for the test report and optionally set a verdict for the table.

enable.description: True if the create_report_table operation is to be processed, false otherwise.

description.description: An author provided description for the use of the create_report_table op.

table_src.description: The source of data to be written into the report table.

transform_list.description: Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to creating report table.
Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to creating report table.
Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to creating report table.
Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to creating report table.
Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to creating report table.

display_name.description: The name of the table displayed in the report.

report_group.description: The report group that the table will be placed in.

table_verdict.description: A verdict that is assigned to the report table. Typically this uses a similar query, but one that generates a single 0 or 1 value.

enable.description: True if table_verdict is to be processed, false otherwise.

passed_verdict_explanation.description: An explanation provided to the report when the verdict is PASS.

failed_verdict_explanation.description: An explanation provided to the report when the verdict is FAIL.

apply_test_verdict.description: True (default) applies table verdict to test verdict, false does not.

enable.description: This source is processed if true, ignored otherwise.

items.description: One of the following object types are valid for the run_influx_db_query operation; and only one per dst object.

description.description: An author provided description for this dst.

format.description: We match format to 'scalar' for this combination of properties.

data.description: The value of the scalar data. The type will be determined by the type field. If not specified, the type will be determined by the presence of quotes or not.

description.description: Description of the scalar data

format.description: We match format to 'list' for this combination of properties.

data.description: The list of data, can be empty, must be simple data suitable for BLL properties.

description.description: Description of the list data

type_list.description: List of types that correspond to the data; can be empty.

format.description: We match format to 'json_object' for this combination of properties.

data.description: An object or a list of objects (list can be empty).

description.description: Description of the json object data

table_data_schema.description: The list of data, can be empty, must be simple data suitable for BLL properties.

columns.description: The schema information for all the columns in the db table.

items.description: An object representing the schema of a single column within the database table.

is_collection.description: True if the data in the column is a collection (a single cell is [...]). The type of data is defined by 'type' property.

nullable.description: True (not zero) if the data can be null, false otherwise or not present.

default_value.description: The value to use if not supplied when adding a row to a table.

primary_key.description: True (not zero) if the column is a primary key, false otherwise or not present.

table_data_row_data.description: The list of data, can be empty, must be simple data suitable for BLL properties.

column_names.description: The names of the columns related to the data retrieved.

items.description: A single row of data retrieved. FIXME: This needs to be constrained to string type only.

format.description: We match format to 'table_data' for this combination of properties.

sql_cmd.description: The SQL that was used to generate the data.

description.description: Description of the table data

scalar_type.description: These are the data types for the common_data_format objects to use internally. The json type was removed and may need to be added later if needed.

common_data_format.description: This represents the latest design decisions for how data is internally represented as it passes between src and dst sub ops.

sql_statement_dynamic.description: Dynamic SQL code that will be added dependent upon its properties.

enable.description: A flag indicating if this operation should be used.

static.description: This is a static portion of the SQL statement.

for_loop_expression.description: Defines properties of the for loop.

init.description: The initial value of the loop control variable in the for loop.

evaluator.description: The operator used to compare the loop control variable to the limit.

limit.description: The limit value of the loop control variable in the for loop.

post_loop_add.description: The increment of the loop control variable after performing each operation.

control_variable.description: This variable holds the current value for the loop's evaluation, should be treated as read only.

python_script.description: Defines properties of running a python script.

filename.description: The python script to be executed.

function.description: The function in the python script to be executed.

dst.description: Output of the function will be sent to the corresponding destination in the list of destinations.

description.description: An author provided description for this dst.

transform_list.description: Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to sending to the variable dst.

description.description: An author provided description for the use of this dst.

transform_list.description: Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to sending to dst.

description.description: An author provided description for the use of this dst.

transform_list.description: Author provided explicit transformations to perform on the data prior to sending to dst.
